Class Arithmetic

  • java.lang.Object
    • Arithmetic
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Addition, Multiplication, Subtraction

    abstract class Arithmetic
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class sets the framework for all other calculation classes
    Version:
    January 22, 2018
    Author:
    Jason Zhu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Scanner input 
      protected int leftOperand 
      protected int rightOperand 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Arithmetic()
      This constructor method randomly sets the values for both operand between 1 to 9 inclusive

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract boolean checkAnswer(int a)
      This abstract method requires subclasses to have a checkAnaswer() method
      int getAnswer()
      This method uses a Scanner object to get an integer as answer from the user It takes no parameters
      int getLeftOperand()
      This method returns the value of leftOperand It takes no parameters
      abstract java.lang.String getQuestion()
      This abstract method requires subclasses to have a getQuestion() method
      int getRightOperand()
      This method returns the value of rightOperand It takes no parameters
      void setLeftOperand(int operand)
      This mutator method changes the leftOperand variable to the integer parameter, if the parameter is not a valid value, leftOperand is set automatically to 1 It does not return a value
      void setRightOperand(int operand)
      This mutator method changes the RightOperand variable to the integer parameter, if the parameter is not a valid value, rightOperand is set automatically to 1 It does not return a value

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Arithmetic

        public Arithmetic()
        This constructor method randomly sets the values for both operand between 1 to 9 inclusive
        See Also:
        Math

    • Method Detail

      • setLeftOperand

        public void setLeftOperand(int operand)
        This mutator method changes the leftOperand variable to the integer parameter, if the parameter is not a valid value, leftOperand is set automatically to 1 It does not return a value
        Parameters:
        operand - The operand value(int) the user wishes to use

      • setRightOperand

        public void setRightOperand(int operand)
        This mutator method changes the RightOperand variable to the integer parameter, if the parameter is not a valid value, rightOperand is set automatically to 1 It does not return a value
        Parameters:
        operand - The operand value(int) the user wishes to use

      • getLeftOperand

        public int getLeftOperand()
        This method returns the value of leftOperand It takes no parameters
        Returns:
        int - left operand

      • getRightOperand

        public int getRightOperand()
        This method returns the value of rightOperand It takes no parameters
        Returns:
        int - right operand

      • getQuestion

        public abstract java.lang.String getQuestion()
        This abstract method requires subclasses to have a getQuestion() method

      • getAnswer

        public int getAnswer()
        This method uses a Scanner object to get an integer as answer from the user It takes no parameters
        Returns:
        int - answer
        See Also:
        Scanner

      • checkAnswer

        public abstract boolean checkAnswer(int a)
        This abstract method requires subclasses to have a checkAnaswer() method
